title: Die Linke - Wikipedia
snippet: 'The Left'), also known as the ... political party in Germany. The party was founded in 2007 as the result of the merger of the Party of Democratic Socialism (PDS) and Labour and Social Justice – The Electoral Alternative....

title: Left Party | Germany, Politics, Origin, & Election Results | Britannica
snippet: The Left (Die Linke) is a German political party that ruled East Germany as the Socialist Unity Party of Germany (SED) and now contests elections in united Germany.

title: Die Linke | Parties in the German Bundestag
snippet: Profile: Die Linke (i.e. the Left) was formed in 2007 from the merger of the PDS – the democratic successor to the East German party SED – and the left-wing SPD breakaway group WASG.

title: The Unlikely Revival of Germany’s Far Left - CEPA
snippet: Tracing its roots back to East Germany and the Kremlin puppet Socialist Unity Party (SED), the old Die Linke simply found issues like the war in Ukraine and the Covid-19 pandemic too divisive to solve.

title: A Successful Model? Die Linke (the Left Party — Germany) | SpringerLink
snippet: Die Linke is the direct successor to the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED) of the former German Democratic Republic. It has undergone a significant political transformation, firstly as the Party of Democratic Socialism (PDS), embracing the democratic red, green, feminist and pacifist politics typical of the new European left in the 1990s.
